question: Which of these dopants is NOT used to increase the conductivity of a semi-conductor?
explanation: There are two types of dopants used in doping the tetravalent Si or Ge: (i) Pentavalent (valency 5); like Arsenic (As), Antimony (Sb), Phosphorous (P), etc (ii) Trivalent (valency 3); like Indium (In), Boron (B), Aluminium (Al), etc
